meanings.definition: Sleep longer or later than intended.
meanings.sent1: She always oversleeps on weekends and misses breakfast.
meanings.sent2: If you oversleep, you might be late for school.
meanings.sent3: He oversleeps so often that his alarm clock is tired of waking him up.
meanings.sent4: Her love for sleep oversleeps every morning, refusing to let her wake up.
meanings.sent5: The cat oversleeps in the sun, enjoying the warmth on its fur.

meanings.definition: To sleep beyond the usual or proper time for waking.
meanings.sent1: Don't oversleep on the day of your important meeting.
meanings.sent2: If you oversleep, you might miss the sunrise.
meanings.sent3: The bear oversleeps through winter, missing all the fun in the snow.
meanings.sent4: The old clock oversleeps, its hands frozen in time.
meanings.sent5: The flower oversleeps in the shade, missing the morning sunlight.
